image.altText: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton speaks to the media at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Coalition will unwind laws allowing workers to ignore unreasonable out-of-hours contact from their bosses, Peter Dutton says, committing his party to undoing the 'right to disconnect' if it wins the next federal election.

title.children: Peter Dutton says Coalition will repeal 'right to disconnect' laws if it wins government

image.altText: Headshots of Donald Trump and Taylor Swift looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift is at the centre of a far-right conspiracy theory that claims the singer is part of an elaborate plot to rig football games and deliver Joe Biden the presidency. Here's how it unfolded.

title.children: Why Taylor Swift could be 'the Achilles heel' for Donald Trump in the 2024 election

image.altText: A man rummages through building debris.

props.synopsis: Key mediators in the Gaza conflict are warning of repercussions if Israel launches a ground invasion in Rafah as 44 Palestinians are reported dead in air strikes.

title.children: Israeli air strikes kill 44 in Rafah amid plans for potential ground invasion

image.altText: A woman in scrubs walking down a hallway with her hands on her head

props.synopsis: Hospitals have become a strange new battleground in the fight against COVID, with doctors and public health experts concerned that too many patients are catching the virus — and an alarming number are dying — as a result of inadequate infection control.

title.children: 'Robodebt of medicine': Patients are catching COVID and dying in hospitals, doctors say

image.altText: firefighters standing outside an Ice Arena building.

props.synopsis: SA Health says more than 20 people went to the Royal Adelaide Hospital early this morning after attending the Ice Arena in Adelaide's inner west yesterday.

title.children: Suspected carbon monoxide leak at Adelaide Ice Arena sees more than 20 people attend hospital

image.altText: A middle-aged woman with dark hair speaks at a podium with Hungarian flags behind her.

props.synopsis: Katalin Novak, a close ally of Prime Minister Viktor Orbán, resigns after coming under mounting pressure for pardoning a man convicted of helping to cover up sexual abuse in a children's home.

title.children: Hungarian president resigns over pardon for convicted child abuse accomplice

image.altText: A composite image of Annastacia Palaszczuk removing a surgical face mask and Scott Morrison.

props.synopsis: Scott Morrison appointed more women to his cabinet than any Australian prime minister before him. Yet his prime ministership was dogged by the perception that he and the Coalition had a problem with women.

title.children: Did Morrison have a problem with women? Former Qld premier says a call she had with him may provide insight

image.altText: Lauren Jackson smiles

props.synopsis: Lauren Jackson reveals she will not play in the Olympic Games later this year just after the Opals beat Germany to qualify for Paris.

title.children: Opals qualify for Paris Olympics but Lauren Jackson says she won't be there

image.altText: Jemima Montag competing in the women's 20km walk at the 2023 world titles.

props.synopsis: Jemima Montag shows why she will be among the medal favourites at the Paris Olympics after smashing her national 20-kilometre walk record.

title.children: Olympic medal contender Montag breaks Australian record in 20km walk

image.altText: a surfer on a massive wave with his partner in the foreground sitting in a little tender boat

props.synopsis: Torren Martyn and his partner Aiyana Powell barely knew how to sail before embarking on 12-month voyage through the tropics. On their little boat Calypte, the couple braved wild weather, survived a brush with death and scored some of the best waves of their lives.

title.children: With no sailing experience, an Aussie surfer set off on a 9,000km adventure and had the trip of a lifetime

image.altText: King Charles and Camilla are seen through the window of a car.

props.synopsis: While it is wholly inappropriate to engage in wild conjecture about King Charles's private health matters, it's a singular job with pre-determined stand-ins so it's surely important to consider what will happen next, writes Juliet Rieden.

title.children: King Charles's cancer diagnosis holds a different problem for Australia

image.altText: Greenish-yellow glass fruits glow on a blue table in a dark room

props.synopsis: The Art Gallery of WA has meticulously curated thousands of pieces of delicate glass created by a First Nations artist to tell significant stories.

title.children: Luminous glass artworks bring troubling histories into the light

image.altText: The back of a woman's head looking at a laptop screen on a table.

props.synopsis: Abigail* says her ex-husband used his technology skills to control and monitor both in and out of their relationship. Experts say common apps are being misused to stalk victims of domestic violence.

title.children: When Abigail's ex sent emails detailing what she had said in therapy, it gave her goosebumps

image.altText: Side photo of Queensland police car.

props.synopsis: A 26-year-old woman has been charged with attempted murder, after a three-month-old baby was found with what police say appeared to be a stab wound to the abdomen.

title.children: Woman, 26, charged with attempted murder after three-month-old found with reported stab wound

image.altText: a large wavy sculpture outside the brisbane court precinct in the sunshine

props.synopsis: The stabbing death of an Ipswich grandmother has reignited debate about youth justice in Queensland — in particular, opening the doors of Childrens Court matters to journalists.

title.children: Keeping Childrens Court matters out of the media allows youth an 'opportunity to make a mistake', lawyer says

image.altText: Red and silver striped beer keg sits in front of old wooden wine barrels

props.synopsis: Kegs are being stolen in their hundreds every week from brewers, pubs and bars, costing independent businesses dearly. Thieves are operating in the dead of night and in some cases removing tracking devices from kegs, leading to speculation over who is responsible.

title.children: This brewery has tracking devices on its kegs — and some are turning up in places they shouldn't

image.altText: Victoria ambulance paramedic badge on the sleeve of an officer's shirt

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the Murray River in Moama after reports a man had been seriously injured in the Southern 80 waterski race.

title.children: Man dies in waterskiing event on Victorian–NSW border

image.altText: two women and their dog are searching in dense bushland

props.synopsis: A week after Samantha Murphy went missing near Ballarat, a handful of determined volunteers are maintaining the search, but harsh terrain and unpredictable mineshafts make excursions deeper into the bushland dangerous.

title.children: Melbourne volunteers persist in bushland search for Samantha Murphy as police focus on detective work

image.altText: A historic black and white photo of the 1924 olympic team walking together.

props.synopsis: With Paris hosting the Olympics for the first time since 1924, Charles Jardine's family saw it as the perfect time to share what he brought back from the City of Light 100 years ago.

title.children: Remarkable 1924 Paris Olympics collection tells story of NSW sheep farmer boxing for Australia

image.altText: A thermometer sticking out of the sand at the beach

props.synopsis: Sensational reporting and social media are being blamed for driving fear and anxiety about weather amid confusion about how to understand official forecasts.

title.children: Anxiety on the rise over 'sensational' weather stories

image.altText: Aboriginal woman talking to reporters flanked by family

props.synopsis: Police body cam played in court, showing the final moments Mr George was seen alive as he was led to a watch house cell. More than an hour later police checked on him and found his body.

title.children: Family calls for justice, explanation of how their brother died in police custody

image.altText: A young girl posing in a denim jacket and novelty sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Relatives have found the body of a six-year-old Palestinian girl along with the bodies of five of her family members and two ambulance workers who had gone to save her.

title.children: Bodies of Gaza girl, ambulance team trapped under Israeli fire found after 12 days

image.altText: Three actresses standing on the red carpet

props.synopsis: The best and brightest of Australian film and television grace the red carpet for the 2024 AACTA Awards on the Gold Coast.

title.children: All the stylish looks at Australia's night of nights, the 2024 AACTA Awards

image.altText: A man wearing a white business shirt leaning against a fence in front of green grass and trees.

props.synopsis: Ahead of the March 16 election, the LNP in Brisbane is vowing to give out grants of up to $10,000 to community and sports clubs so they can bolster the security at their premises.

title.children: LNP promises security grants for sports clubs in Brisbane City Council election race

image.altText: A middle-aged man stands on the beach holding a bucket and rubbish tongs.

props.synopsis: Andy Orr did not dive into a life of luxury when he received an inheritance but instead dedicated his time to cleaning up the beaches of Sydney Harbour.

title.children: Inheritance allows 'Guardian of Sydney Harbour' to quit his job and pick up plastic every day

image.altText: A woman stands outside a newsagency holding a lotto ticket

props.synopsis: Australians have spent more than $7 billion in recent years on lotteries, at a time when cost of living and inflation are biting into household budgets.

title.children: Australians are spending more on lotto tickets than ever before despite cost of living crisis

image.altText: A person wearing black and pink protective gear rides a white, blue, and black motorbike at high speed on a race track.

props.synopsis: Tayla Relph is the only Australian, and one of only 22 women across the world, to score a spot on the grid for the inaugural FIM Women's Circuit Racing World Championship in Europe later this year.

title.children: Australia's fastest female road racer is about to make motorcycling history … again

image.altText: Two males sitting at table holding up photos

props.synopsis: A unique stash of historic photos that floated 60 kilometres on floodwaters from a far north Queensland town down the rugged Barron River to the coast is reunited with its owner.

title.children: Mystery of floating photos solved as precious memories come flooding back to esky owner

image.altText: Police tape

props.synopsis: The "unsatisfactory" investigation into the 2021 home invasion contributed to the suspect being found not guilty, according to the judge's decision handed down last year.

title.children: Police probe into home invasion in same south-east Queensland suburb where grandmother killed was 'entirely unsatisfactory,' judge found

image.altText: A portrait of a man wearing glasses and a red t-shirt

props.synopsis: There are an estimated 175,000 households on social housing wait lists across Australia. Those caught by the safety net hope renewed government attention can help to ease the crisis.

title.children: 'Lucky' tenant says public housing saved his life and countless more as questions raised over $10 billion fund

image.altText: Opium bulb at harvest in Laos PDR.

props.synopsis: After the Taliban outlawed opium production in Afghanistan, war-torn Myanmar became the world's main supplier. But former poppy farmers in Shan state say they have a solution for getting out of the drug industry.

title.children: Myanmar supplies most of Australia's drugs, but can a new coffee culture help kick the habit?

image.altText: A man and woman in traditional Balinese dress stand outside a temple

props.synopsis: This patch of dirt was once a lush jungle that locals say was home to ancient spirits. Now, luxury villas, bars and restaurants are being built here instead to bring in foreign investors.

title.children: A Russian-backed 'city' is emerging over the back fence of Bali's Eat Pray Love house

image.altText: A police car outside a property in south-east Queensland.

props.synopsis: Queensland police allege a 43-year-old woman was taken from a property in Doolandella on Friday afternoon by a group of men and assaulted, before being driven to Forest Lake.

title.children: Two men charged over alleged kidnapping and torture of woman in Brisbane's south face court

image.altText: A side-on close-up shot of Property Council WA chief executive Sandra Brewer.

props.synopsis: The property council chief wins the preselection battle for the Liberal heartland seat of Cottesloe, defeating former WA Liberal Party leader David Honey.

title.children: Former WA Liberal Party leader David Honey loses preselection battle for Cottesloe to Sandra Brewer

image.altText: Qatar players hold the trophy after winning the men's Asian Cup final.

props.synopsis: In front of a boisterous home crowd, Qatar successfully defends the men's Asian Cup title, with Akram Afif slotting three penalties in the 3-1 victory over Jordan in the final.

title.children: Qatar beats Jordan to retain Asian Cup crown
